doc.field: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of AFL-CIO Serials
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of AFL-CIO Serials

The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of AFL-CIO Serials contains over 100 titles published by and about the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations. The collection dates between 1887 and 2001, with the bulk of the material dating from the 1940s through the 1980s. Topics include labor related convention proceedings, council and president reports, and United States politics.

The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of AFL-CIO Serials contains over 100 titles published by and about the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations. The collection dates between 1887 and 2001, with the bulk of the material dating from the 1940s through the 1980s. Topics include labor related convention proceedings, council and president reports, and United States politics.
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of AFL-CIO Serials contains over 100 titles published by and about the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations (AFL-CIO). The collection dates between 1887 and 2001, with the bulk of the material dating from the 1940s through the 1980s. Topics include state and national AFL, CIO, and AFL-CIO annual and constitutional convention proceedings; council and president reports; and AFL-CIO reports on United States politics. The majority of the publications are conference proceedings from national CIO and AFL-CIO conventions, as well as Illinois State Federation of Labor and the Illinois State Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations. Other organizations represented include the New York State AFL-CIO, Iowa State Federation of Labor, the AFL-CIO Committee on Political Education (COPE), and the AFL-CIO's Industrial Union Department.

This collection combines serials relating to the AFL-CIO drawn from two discrete groups of material held by the Tamiment Library. The first was a partially inventoried backlog of serials, received by the library through donations, subscriptions, and in archival collections. The second group consisted of around 1,700 serials, newspapers, and magazines, organized by title as an artificial collection, referred to as Periodicals.001 or Boxed Newspapers. This material was combined, inventoried, and arranged and described in subject-based categories in 2017. The accession number related to this collection is 2017.049.
Due to the fragile nature of certain original materials, researchers may be required to consult microfilm copies, preservation photocopies, or digital images of material in this collection.
